text: Is there some overview or benchmark between DataFrames and IndexedTables (used in JuliaDB), with both compile-time and run-time estimations?

elements.text: Is there some overview or benchmark between DataFrames and IndexedTables (used in JuliaDB), with both compile-time and run-time estimations?

text: I do not think so. In general these packages have very different API so it will be hard to do. What do you want to benchmark exactly?

elements.text: I do not think so. In general these packages have very different API so it will be hard to do. What do you want to benchmark exactly?

text:
How about generic Tables.jl or TableOperations.jl methods? I just want to understand, what is the difference between these two use-cases? And what operations are slower or faster when you have:
(a) sorted primary key, and
(b) static schema.
